[[Rivian R1X]] | engine = | motor = | drivetrain = IWD 4x4 | powerout = {{cvt|402-835|hp|kW|0}} | doors = 4 doors + 1 in rear | transmission = Single-speed | battery = 7,776 cells (2170 type) in a nine-module assembly for the 135 kWh liquid-cooled lithium-ion battery pack{{cite news |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/a40514350/2022-rivian-r1s-drive/ |title=2022 Rivian R1S Has Appeal, Capability, and Lots of Promise |last=Capparella |first=Joey |date=6 July 2022 |work=Car and Driver |access-date=22 July 2022}} | range = | electric_range = {{cvt|316|miles|km|0}} | charging = | wheelbase = {{cvt|121.1|in|mm|0|order=flip}}{{cite news |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/rivian-r1s-electric-suv-review-drive-range-photos-price-2022-7 |title=I drove Rivian's new R1S — it's like 3 dream cars wrapped up in one ultra-cool electric SUV |last=Levin |first=Tim |date=15 July 2022 |work=Business Insider |access-date=22 July 2022}} | length = {{cvt|200.8|in|mm|0|order=flip}}{{cite news |url=https://www.motortrend.com/reviews/2022-rivian-r1s-first-test-review/ |title=2022 Rivian R1S First Test: Another Showstopper |author1=Cortina, Miguel |author2=Martin, Darren |date=August 31, 2022 |work=Motor Trend |access-date=26 October 2022}} | width = {{cvt|79.3|in|mm|0|order=flip}} | height = {{cvt|71.5|–|77.3|in|mm|0|order=flip}} | weight = {{cvt|7068|lb|kg|0|order=flip}} | predecessor = | successor = }} The '''Rivian R1S''' is an [[Electric vehicle|all-electric]] [[Full-size car|full-size]] [[Off-road vehicle|off-road]] [[SUV]] manufactured by [[Rivian Automotive]]. Customer deliveries started in 2022.{{cite web | url=https://www.teslarati.com/rivian-r1s-customer-deliveries/ | title=Rivian starts R1S customer deliveries | date=29 August 2022 }}{{Cite web |title=2022 Rivian R1S SUV: Review, Trims, Specs, Price, New Interior Features, Exterior Design, and Specifications |url=https://carbuzz.com/cars/rivian/r1s |access-date=2022-06-12 |website=CarBuzz |language=en-us}} The car took nearly 10 years to develop. Depending on the configuration, it has either two or four electric [[motor]]s.{{Cite web |title=2022 Rivian R1S Overview - An expert's take |first = Joe | last = Wiesenfelder | url=https://www.cars.com/research/rivian-r1s-2022/ |date= |website=cars.com |access-date=12 June 2022}}{{Cite web |title=R1S - Rivian |url=https://rivian.com/r1s |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221030232745/https://rivian.com/r1s |archive-date=31 October 2022 |access-date=31 October 2022 |website=Rivian}}{{better source|date=June 2022}} ==Design== [[File:Rivian R1S, Howard Ave, Burlingame 2.jpg|thumb|left|Rear view, Launch Edition (Oct 2022)]] It is designed to hold seven passengers and accelerate from [[0 to 60 mph]] (0 to 97 km/h) in 3 seconds, due to its {{Convert|835|Hp|kW PS|abbr=on}} combined output power.{{Cite web |date=2022-03-03 |title=2022 Rivian R1S: What We Know So Far |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/rivian/r1s |access-date=2022-06-12 |website=Car and Driver |language=en-us}} It shares 91% of its components with the [[Rivian R1T]].{{Cite web |title=Inside the automotive startup taking EVs off-road |url=https://www.engadget.com/2018-05-21-rivian-ev-truck-suv-detroit.html |access-date=2022-06-27 |website=Engadget |language=en-US}} Rivian's flat, low [[center of gravity]] chassis makes it an "electric vehicle [[skateboard]]".{{Cite web |title=Rivian Reveals 'Skateboard' Chassis At Michigan Conference |url=https://www.wglt.org/show/wglts-sound-ideas/2018-06-19/rivian-reveals-skateboard-chassis-at-michigan-conference |access-date=2022-06-27 |website=WGLT |language=en}} The vehicle is equipped for semi-autonomous driving according to level 3 and designed for road traffic and off-road driving. ===Powertrain=== As announced in 2018, the R1S was planned to be offered with three different traction battery capacities and power outputs; all planned versions included four traction motors,{{cite news |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a25323098/2022-rivian-r1s-electric-suv-photos-info/ |title=The 2021 Rivian R1S Is an Electric Seven-Passenger SUV Claiming Supercar Acceleration |author=Golson, Daniel |date=November 27, 2018 |work=Car and Driver |access-date=26 October 2022}} in which each wheel is driven by an independent traction motor, allowing full-time [[all-wheel drive]] with [[torque vectoring]]. The quad-motor version (QM) uses electric traction motors developed by [[Robert Bosch GmbH]], but these are carried on the vehicle's frame; the R1S does not use [[wheel hub motor]]s like the [[Lordstown Endurance]]. As delivered in 2022, the QM R1S has a combined output of {{cvt|835|hp}} and {{cvt|908|lbft}}, split {{cvt|415|/|420|hp}} and {{cvt|413|/|495|lbft}} front/rear. {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:100%;text-align:center;" |+R1S configurations{{cite news |url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/rivian-r1s-electric-suv-will-get-max-pack-battery-dual-motor-awd/ |title=Rivian R1S Gets R1T's Dual-Motor, Max Pack Configuration and Nearly Matches Its Big Range |author=Banner, Justin |date=March 2, 2023 |work=Motor Trend |access-date=23 May 2023}}{{cite web |url=https://rivian.com/vehicle-studio/r1s |title=Rivian R1S Vehicle Studio |publisher=Rivian Automotive |access-date=23 May 2023}} ! colspan=2 rowspan=2 {{diagonal split header|Battery
(kW-hr)|Motors}} ! Dual-Motor (DM) !! Performance Dual-Motor (PDM) !! Quad-Motor (QM) |- ! colspan=3 | Range |- ! Standard | (105) | {{cvt|260|mi}} || style="background:#ddd;" | N/A || style="background:#ddd;" | N/A |- ! Large | (135) | colspan=2 | {{cvt|340|mi}} || {{cvt|321|mi}} |- ! Max | (180) | style="background:#ddd;" | N/A || est. {{cvt|390|mi}} || (not yet available) |- | colspan=5 style="background:#aaa;font-size:20%" |   |- ! colspan=2 | Output | approx. {{cvt|600|hp}} | approx. {{cvt|700|hp}} | {{cvt|835|hp}} |} Rivian has announced plans to reduce prices by offering dual-motor (DM) versions starting in 2024, with independent traction motors for the front and rear axles,{{cite news |url=https://insideevs.com/news/570503/rivian-dual-motor-price-increase/ |title=Rivian Announces Dual Motor And Smaller Battery Options; Hefty Price Increases |author=Moloughney, Tom |date=March 1, 2022 |work=Inside EVs |access-date=26 October 2022}} using "Enduro" motors developed by Rivian for the [[Rivian EDV|EDV]].{{cite news |url=https://insideevs.com/news/572896/rivian-new-tech-under-development/ |title=Rivian Announces New Tech Under Development |author=Kane, Mark |date=March 12, 2022 |work=Inside EVs |access-date=26 October 2022}}{{cite news |url=https://insideevs.com/news/664253/rivian-dual-motor-production-details/ |title=Rivian Provides Update On Dual-Motor Production Ramp-up |author=Dnistran, Iulian |date=April 26, 2023 |work=Inside EVs |access-date=23 May 2023}} DM versions will be offered with two different battery capacities (standard and large) for the R1S, with slightly greater corresponding range as the weight and efficiency should improve with two motors. Maximum output of the dual-motor version is expected to be >{{cvt|600|hp}} and >{{cvt|600|lbft}}, which is a decrease from the quad-motor version; a "Performance Dual Motor" (PDM) option was added in April 2023, which raises output to approximately {{cvt|700|hp}} through a software modification.{{cite news |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/4/7/23673961/rivian-performance-dual-motor-availability-max-pack-battery |title=Rivian's new 'Performance' powertrain lets R1T reservation holders keep their big battery |author=Shakir, Umar |date=April 7, 2023 |work=The Verge |access-date=23 May 2023}} Production of the "Enduro" motor drive units began in February 2023; most have been used to ramp up EDV production, but DM R1S SUVs with the Large battery pack were first delivered to customers in May 2023.{{cite news |url=https://www.autoevolution.com/news/rivian-dual-motor-configurations-will-start-shipping-this-month-214323.html |title=Rivian Dual-Motor Configurations Will Start Shipping This Month |author=Agatie, Cristian |date=1 May 2023 |work=Autoevolution |access-date=23 May 2023}} The extended range ("Max Pack") battery has been delayed until 2023.{{cite news |url=https://www.thedrive.com/tech/43691/rivian-delays-400-mile-max-battery-and-base-model-r1t-r1s-until-2023 |title=Rivian Delays 400+ Mile Max Battery and Base Model R1T, R1S Until 2023 |author=Stumpf, Rob |date=January 3, 2022 |work=The Drive |access-date=1 November 2022}} In addition, the smaller ("Standard") battery is not scheduled to be delivered until 2024; the Standard battery will use [[lithium iron phosphate]] (LFP) chemistry to reduce costs by eliminating nickel and cobalt.{{cite news |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2022/03/10/rivian-changing-battery-cells-to-lfp-following-tesla-and-high-nickel.html |title=Rivian will follow Tesla and change the type of battery cells it uses in standard packs |author=Kolodny, Lara |date=March 10, 2022 |work=CNBC |access-date=26 October 2022}} ===Consumption and performance=== The 2022 Rivian R1S was rated by the [[United States Environmental Protection Agency|EPA]] with a consumption of {{cvt|69|mpge}} for the combined city+highway driving cycle and a total range of {{cvt|316|mi}} when equipped with the "Large" 135 kW-hr battery and quad-motor drivetrain.{{cite web |url=https://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/Find.do?action=sbs&id=44461 |title=2022 Rivian R1S |website=fueleconomy.gov |publisher=United States Environmental Protection Agency |access-date=26 October 2022}} Acceleration from 0 to {{cvt|60|mph}} was tested by ''[[Motor Trend]]'' in August 2022 at 3.1 seconds on all-season tires and 3.2 seconds on all-terrain tires. Corresponding {{cvt|1/4|mi}} elapsed times and trap speeds were 11.6 sec at {{cvt|111.2|mph}} on all-season tires, slowing to 11.8 sec at {{cvt|111.6|mph}} with all-terrain tires. ===Storage and towing=== [[File:Rivian_SUV_frunk.jpg|thumb|right|upright=1.2|The frunk of a Rivian R1S]] Total enclosed cargo volume is {{cvt|104.7|cuft}} when the second and third rows are folded down. There is a front trunk (aka "frunk") is under the [[Hood (car)|hood]], where the engine is in most conventional internal combustion engine vehicles, which adds {{cvt|11.1|cuft}} of lockable storage.{{cite news |url=https://www.gearpatrol.com/cars/g40466277/2022-rivian-r1s-review/ |title=2022 Rivian R1S Review: Somehow, More Game-Changing Than Its Truck Brother |last=Mazzucchi |first=Steve |date=6 July 2022 |work=Gear Patrol |access-date=22 July 2022}} In addition, there is a small compartment underneath the cargo floor. Towing capacity is {{cvt|7700|lb}}.{{cite news |url=https://rivian.com/r1s |title=R1S - Rivian}}{{cite magazine |url=https://www.wired.com/review/rivian-r1t-and-r1s/ |title=Review: Rivian R1T and R1S |author=Jancer, Matt |date=August 30, 2022 |magazine=Wired |access-date=26 October 2022}} ===Interior=== Pet comfort mode maintains a user-selected temperature inside the car when the driver is away from the vehicle. A five-passenger option deleting the third row was discontinued in March 2022 before production vehicles began to be delivered; all R1Ss are seven-passenger, three-row vehicles. Third-row seating was reported to be "a little tight for adults", with low cushion height resulting in most people adopting a posture with knees higher than their hips. The glass roof is not equipped with a sunshade and the resulting insolation made ''Motor Trend'' reviewers uncomfortable during comparison testing in the desert at temperatures exceeding {{cvt|100|F}}. The same reviewers criticized the infotainment system, which is not equipped with [[Apple CarPlay]] or [[Android Auto]].{{cite news |url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/2022-rivian-r1s-electric-suv-pros-cons-review/ |title=2022 Rivian R1S SUVOTY Review: You'll Be Floored When You're not Roasting |author=Loh, Edward |date=October 19, 2022 |work=Motor Trend |access-date=26 October 2022}} ===Chassis=== The vehicle has an air suspension which allows for a maximum ground clearance of {{cvt|14.9|in}}, with individual wheels cross-linked to reduce body lean during cornering. In addition, there is a "Camp Mode" that allows the vehicle to level itself when parked on irregular terrain. Maximum wading depth in water is {{cvt|43.1|in|m}}.{{cite news |url=https://www.motortrend.com/reviews/2022-rivian-r1s-first-drive-review/ |title=2022 Rivian R1S Electric SUV First Drive: Is Shorter Sweeter? |last=Markus |first=Frank |date=6 July 2022 |work=Motor Trend |access-date=22 July 2022}} Compared to the R1T, which has a {{cvt|135.8|in}} wheelbase, the R1S rides on a shorter {{cvt|121.1|in}} wheelbase and has a shorter rear overhang, improving [[Approach and departure angles|departure]] and [[breakover angle]]s. This also results in a [[turning circle]] that is nearly {{cvt|4|ft}} smaller for the R1S.{{cite news |url=https://www.motortrend.com/reviews/2022-rivian-r1t-yearlong-review-update-3-versus-r1s/ |title=What's the Difference Between a Rivian R1S and a Rivian R1T? |author1=Evans, Scott |author2=Walker, William |date=October 11, 2022 |work=Motor Trend |access-date=26 October 2022}} ===Trim levels=== The entry-level trim was called the Explore package, which included matte-black interior finishes and heated vegan leather seats.{{cite news |url=https://www.cars.com/articles/rivian-drops-most-affordable-explore-package-for-r1t-r1s-455841/ |title=Rivian Drops Most Affordable Explore Package for R1T, R1S |author=Ulitskaya, Jane |date=August 22, 2022 |website=cars.com |access-date=26 October 2022}} In August 2022, Rivian announced it had discontinued the Explore package citing low demand, simplified assembly and supply chain constraints that would be alleviated with a single option. By eliminating the base trim, Rivian effectively increased prices. The Adventure package upgrades the interior with heated and cooled perforated vegan leather seats, Chilewich woven floor mats, wood or vegan leather accents, and a premium Rivian Elevation sound system designed by [[Meridian Audio]] which includes a removable [[Bluetooth]] speaker.{{cite web |url=https://rivian.com/support/article/whats-included-in-the-adventure-package |title=What's included in the Adventure Package |publisher=Rivian |access-date=26 October 2022}} [[File:Rivian R1S, Howard Ave, Burlingame 3.jpg|thumb|right|R1S Launch edition]] The limited-availability Launch edition included the Adventure package, the large battery, an exclusive Launch green color, and an option to upgrade wheels and tires at no additional cost.{{Cite web |title=Compare Rivian R1S SUV Adventure vs Explore vs Launch Edition |url=https://carbuzz.com/compare/rivian-r1s-suv-adventure-vs-explore-vs-launch-edition |access-date=2022-07-21 |website=CarBuzz |language=en-us}}{{cite web |url=https://rivian.com/support/article/what-is-launch-edition |title=What is Launch Edition |publisher=Rivian |access-date=26 October 2022}} ==History== [[File:Debut of the Rivian R1S SUV at the 2018 Los Angeles Auto Show, November 27, 2018.jpg|thumb|right|Concept Rivian R1S at the Nov 2018 [[Los Angeles Auto Show|LA Auto Show]]]] The Rivian R1S debuted as a [[concept car|prototype model]] first shown at the [[Los Angeles Auto Show]] in November 2018. The prototype shown in LA was said to be in "production form". By December 2019, Rivian had raised $1.3 billion in new funding for this and the [[Rivian R1T|R1T Truck]].{{Cite news |date=2019-12-23 |title=Electric-Truck Maker Rivian Raises $1.3 Billion in New Funding |language=en |work=Bloomberg.com |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-23/electric-truck-maker-rivian-raises-1-3-billion-led-by-t-rowe |access-date=2022-06-27}} ===Delivery delays=== The first two R1S vehicles were delivered to the CEO, R.J. Scaringe, and the CFO, Claire McDonough, in December 2021.{{cite news |url=https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/rivian-r1s-suv-delivery-production/ |title=Rivian delivers first R1S electric SUVs |author=Golson, Daniel |date=December 20, 2021 |work=Road/Show |publisher=CNet |access-date=26 October 2022}} Rivian announced in mid-June 2022 that there would be a delay for some deliveries of its R1S electric SUV. The company cites the delay is due to supply chain issues and limited service infrastructure.{{cite news |last=Gunther |first=Cory |date=15 June 2022 |title=Rivian Delays Delivery of Its R1S Electric SUV, Again |work=Review Geek |url=https://www.reviewgeek.com/120950/rivian-delays-delivery-of-its-r1s-electric-suv-again/ |access-date=18 June 2022}} Deliveries to customers began in late August 2022.{{cite news |url=https://electrek.co/2022/08/27/rivian-delivering-r1s/ |title=Rivian begins delivering its R1S electric SUV to customers |author=Dow, Jameson |date=August 27, 2022 |work=Electrek |access-date=26 October 2022}} The first vehicles to be released were equipped with the large (135 kW/hr) battery and quad-motor drivetrain. === Price changes === In March 2022, Rivian announced the price of the R1S would increase by 20%, jumping to $84,500 from $70,000 for the base model.{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/technology/rivian-hikes-vehicle-prices-by-20-citing-inflationary-pressure-2022-03-02/ |title=Rivian raises EV prices by 20%, inviting customer ire, taunt from Musk |author=Jin, Hyunjoo |date=March 1, 2022 |work=Reuters |access-date=26 October 2022}} After receiving negative feedback, Rivian honored the original prices for pre-orders made before the price increase.{{cite news |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2022/03/03/rivian-rolls-back-big-price-increases-on-pre-orders-after-customer-backlash.html |title=Rivian rolls back big price increases on preorders after customer backlash |author=Rosevear, John |date=March 3, 2022 |work=CNBC |access-date=26 October 2022}}{{cite news |url=https://www.gq.com/story/rivian-r1s-worlds-most-hyped-electric-suv |title=Behind the Wheel of the Rivian R1S, the World's Most Hyped Electric SUV |author=Baldwin, Rosecrans |date=August 16, 2022 |work=Gentleman's Quarterly |access-date=26 October 2022}} In August 2022, Rivian cancelled the base Explore trim level, forcing people who pre-ordered the Explore to either cancel or upgrade to the more expensive Adventure trim.{{cite news |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/8/18/23312081/rivian-r1t-r1s-price-increase-explore-package-discontinued |title=Some Rivian customers aren't happy the company canceled its most affordable electric truck |author=Clark, Mitchell |date=August 18, 2022 |work=The Verge |access-date=26 October 2022}} ==Competition== * [[GMC Hummer EV]] * [[Polestar 3]] * [[Tesla Model Y]] * [[Tesla Model X]] * [[Audi
